p: We compile the model using GCC [ 34], importing GSL [ 35] for pseudo-random number generation, and perform simulations on the University of Florida High Performance Computing Cluster. On an AMD Opteron 4284, each model run takes ~2 minutes per simulated year for the Yucatán population (1.82 million). Memory use is ~0.7 GB for Yucatán. The C ++ source code is available at https://github.com/tjhladish/dengue. We use R for analysis of simulated data and figure generation [ 36]. We expand our previous model fit to include more long-term clinical and severe case data (Table A in S1 Text) [ 37] and a 1987 serosurvey [ 38, 39]; we also use an updated AbcSmc [ 40], which now includes covariance when selecting new parameter combinations.
